title: Senate Approves Trumps Bid to Cancel Foreign Aid and Funds for NPR and PBS Stations
description: The bill to claw back 9 billion in congressionally approved spending passed over the objections of Republicans who said it abdicated the legislative branchs power of the purse.

title: Trumps New Strategy on Epstein Fallout Blame the Democrats
description: President Trump said the outrage among his supporters over the Epstein case was just the latest scam cooked up by Democrats.

title: Maurene Comey, Prosecutor of Jeffrey Epstein, Is Fired
description: Maurene Comey, who is the daughter of the former F.B.I. director James Comey, worked on the criminal cases against Jeffrey Epstein and his associate Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: Trump Has Penned Letter To Fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell
description: The president waved a copy of a draft letter firing Jerome H. Powell at a meeting in the Oval Office with House Republicans. It remains to be seen whether he follows through with his threat.

title: Can Trump Fire Powell? He Likely Lacks Case to Remove Fed Chair, Experts Say.
description: The Trump administration is toying with removing Jerome H. Powell as chair of the Federal Reserve, accusing him of mismanaging a multibillion-dollar update to its Washington headquarters.

title: Trumps National Guard Troops Are Questioning Their Mission in L.A.
description: Thousands of National Guard members have served in the L.A. region since last month. Six soldiers spoke in interviews about low morale over the deployment.

title: Documenting L.A.s Surge in Immigration Arrests
description: Jennifer Medina, a political reporter at The New York Times who is based in Los Angeles, speaks with a witness who recorded an immigration raid near a Home Depot.

title: Eswatini Says It Will Repatriate Migrants Deported by the Trump Administration
description: The Trump administration sent five deportees to Eswatini, an African kingdom, saying that their own countries would not take them. But Eswatini says it will send them home.

title: Lawyers for Kilmar Abrego Garcia Question Evidence in Criminal Case
description: The exchanges unfolded at a hearing in Federal District Court in Nashville intended to determine whether Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia should be freed from criminal custody as he awaits trial.

title: Immigrants File Class-Action Lawsuit to Stop ICE Courthouse Arrests
description: The detentions have become a relatively easy way for Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to detain immigrants who are appearing for court dates.

title: Who Killed Love? A Video Game Plays to Male Resentment in China.
description: A popular and contentious game, Revenge on Gold Diggers, sheds light on misogyny, inequality and the feeling among many men that they are economic victims.

title: Adams Eclipses Mamdani in Recent Fund-Raising, as Cuomo Lags Behind
description: Mayor Eric Adams reported raising 1.5 million over the last month, but his inability to qualify for matching funds may hamper his re-election bid.

title: N.Y.C. Panel Withdraws Proposal to Switch to Open Primaries
description: The panel, created by Mayor Eric Adams, said it would introduce other ballot initiatives, but not a proposal that would allow all voters to participate in primaries regardless of party.

title: Germanys Merz and UKs Starmer Meet to Cement Ties as U.S. Steps Back
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merzs trip to London on Thursday is the latest sign of a new world order, in which European nations are uniting amid growing instability.

title: K-Beauty Fans Stock up on Cosmetics After Trumps Tariff Threat
description: American consumers of Korean cosmetics and skin-care products are bulk buying, as President Trump threatens 25 percent tariffs on imports.

title: Trump Has Promised More Tariffs on Mexico. What Happens Next?
description: President Trump has threatened to increase Mexicos tariff rate to 30 percent starting Aug. 1, claiming the country hasnt sufficiently tackled drug cartels.

title: Carney Moves to Reduce Canadas Chinese Steel Imports in Response to Trumps Tariffs
description: Canadas steel industry fears that Chinese steel facing steep tariffs in the United States will be sent north and overwhelm the Canadian market.

title: The Grand Canyon Fire Has North Rim Residents Wary of the Future
description: Fire crews allowed a fire to burn through brush on the Grand Canyons North Rim. Then they lost control.

title: Paulette Jiles, 82, Dies Novelist Evoked the West in News of the World
description: A poet and memoirist as well, she drew a wide readership with her historical fiction, notably with a post-Civil War tale that was adapted for a movie starring Tom Hanks.

title: Trump Is Doing Something No One Wants
description: In his commitment to domination, he is missing an opportunity to shape a new multipolar order that protects Americas interests.

title: The Epstein Story Is Both Conspiracy Theory and Genuine Scandal
description: More than a client list, MAGA is looking for meaning.

title: Dozens of People Are Killed in Iraq Shopping Mall Fire
description: The local governor announced three days of mourning for the victims, who he said included children.

title: Canadian Retailer Couche-Tard Abandons Its 47 Billion Bid to Buy 7-Eleven
description: Alimentation Couche-Tards 47 billion bid spurred changes at the chains Japanese owner. Now, the question is whether that momentum will carry forward.

title: Chinas Aircraft Carriers Push Into Waters Long Dominated by U.S.
description: Recent drills near Japan reflect Chinas ambitions to extend its navys reach and exert greater influence, in the Pacific and beyond.

title: Lightning Kills 1 and Injures 13 on Archery Range in New Jersey
description: The victims range in age from 7 to 61, according to the authorities.
